<mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></mrow> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn </math> Acid <math alttext="K sub a 1 " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>K</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> <math alttext="K sub a 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>K</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>a</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> <math alttext="much greater than 1" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mo>></mo> <mo>></mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> <math alttext="2 times 10 to the negative 2 power" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> <math alttext="2 times 10 to the negative 8 power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1 times 10 to the negative 11 power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> The equilibrium reactions for diprotic oxoacids with a general formula <math alttext="H 2 X O 4 " overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>H</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>XO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> are represented by the equations above. The acid ionization constants for <math alttext="H 2 S e O 4 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SeO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 2 T e O 4 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>TeO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are provided in the table. Which of the following best explains the difference in strength for these two acids?

choices.label: <math alttext="H 2 S e O 4 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SeO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is weaker because <math alttext="S e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Se</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a smaller positive formal charge than <math alttext="T e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Te</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in a decrease in its ability to transfer an <math alttext="H with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="H 2 T e O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>TeO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is weaker because <math alttext="T e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Te</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a smaller positive formal charge than <math alttext="T e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Te</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in a decrease in its ability to transfer an <math alttext="H with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="H 2 S e O 4 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SeO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is weaker because <math alttext="S e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Se</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is more electronegative than <math alttext="T e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Te</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in more stable conjugate bases <math alttext="H S e O 4 with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mn>(</mn> <mtext>HSeO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="S e O 4 with a negative 2 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>SeO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mn>)</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> than those for <math alttext="H 2 T e O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>TeO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> .

<math alttext="H 2 T e O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>TeO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is weaker because <math alttext="T e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Te</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is less electronegative than <math alttext="S e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Se</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in less stable conjugate bases <math alttext="H T e O 4 with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mn>(</mn> <mtext>HTeO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="T e O 4 with a negative 2 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>TeO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mn>)</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> than those for <math alttext="H 2 S e O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SeO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="H 2 T e O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>TeO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is weaker because <math alttext="T e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Te</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is less electronegative than <math alttext="S e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Se</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in less stable conjugate bases <math alttext="H T e O 4 with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mn>(</mn> <mtext>HTeO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="T e O 4 with a negative 2 charge" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>TeO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mn>)</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> than those for <math alttext="H 2 S e O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>SeO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 8.6: Molecular Structure of Acids and Bases

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
